data.sampled:
This statement can be broken down into three sub-statements, each of which will be evaluated separately as follows:
``` 
(false or true) -> True
(false or true) or false -> False
False and not true -> False
``` 
Therefore, the overall statement is "False".

data.sampled:
This statement contains two pairs of terms, each pair connected by an "and" operator. Let us consider them one at a time:
- The first pair consists of "false", followed by "not false". Since "false" implies "not false", this pair evaluates to True.
- The second pair consists of "false" followed by "True". Again, since "false" implies "True", this pair also evaluates to True.
Since both pairs evaluate to True, we can conclude that the overall statement is also True.
Therefore, my answer is "true".
